message.content: Build an animated hero section for the marketing homepage. It should have a headline that reveals word by word on load, a subheading that fades in after, and a CTA button that slides up. Use Framer Motion. Keep it accessible — respect prefers-reduced-motion.

content.text:
`HeroSection` component written. Key decisions:

- `useReducedMotion()` gates all animation — when true, elements appear instantly with no movement
- Headline words use a custom variant with a staggered `delay: i * 0.12s` so they reveal sequentially
- `aria-label` on `<h1>` provides the full headline to screen readers; individual `<motion.span>` elements are `aria-hidden` to avoid repetition
- CTA slides up 24px with a 0.9s delay so it appears after the text is fully revealed

Update `src/app/page.tsx` to replace the static `<section>` with `<HeroSection />`.

message.content: Add a scroll-triggered counter section below the hero — 3 stats: 10k users, 99.9% uptime, 40ms p95 latency. Numbers should count up when they scroll into view.

content.text: `StatsSection` written with `IntersectionObserver` triggering the count-up on scroll. Uses a cubic ease-out over 1400ms. `10000` is formatted as `10k`. `prefers-reduced-motion` skips the animation and shows final values immediately.
